comment: also used for FFBSS; yik”r”k” also used for FFBSS(fs)
also used for FFB, FMB, FFF
also used for FFZ and FFM
also used for FFB, FMB, FFF
mir”ki also FBSS(ms) and FFBSSS(ms); pat”mk” also FBDS(ms) and MBSS(ms)
yak”n” also used for FFBSS; yinat”k” also used for FFBSD(ms)
pa–/parim (co-resident/non-co-resident) can also be generally used for all same-generation affines/cousins (p.33/38)

discussion on p.38 contradicts the claims made in the term chart, where it says that weriki/bemiki are terms for same-generation different sex affines, and pa–/parim (co-resident/non-co-resident) are same-generation same-sex affines. It is likely the forms in the chart on p.33 are indeed errors due to overlap with the other terms
